CIRCUIT COURT OF
TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
PATRICK CRADDOCK, CLERK
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
CHRISTOPHER BLAINE MCGREGOR,
Respondent,
v. CASE NO.: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND,
Petitioner.
OBJECTION TO RESPONDENT’S MOTION TO CONTINUE
COMES NOW, Petitioner BRITTANY GILLILAND, by and through the undersigned
counsel of record, Barbara H. Agricola, with the law firm of Agricola Law, LLC, and files this
Objection to Respondent’s Motion to Continue. In support thereof, Petitioner states as follows:
1. This action was initiated over a year ago on May 2, 2024;
2. This action was originally set for September 11, 2025. Respondent filed a Motion to
Continue on August 14, 2025 [Doc. 247] and this Honorable Court reset the final trial
date to October 17, 2025 [Doc. 249];
3. Respondent is now again filing a Motion to Continue on the grounds that Respondent
is on Minor Child A.K.’s middle school Homecoming Committee. This is not
reasonable grounds for continuing this final trial which has already been continued.
Further, Respondent admits in his Motion to Continue that he has been aware about
this commitment for at least six (6) months, providing him ample time to have resolved
this issue;
4. Further, discovery was issued in this matter on June 24, 2024 [Doc. 16] by Petitioner.
Petitioner issued supplemental discovery requests on September 15, 2025 [Doc. 265].
Respondent has thirty (30) days from the issuance of discovery to respond to
Petitioner’s requests in accordance with the Alabama Rules of Civil Procedure. This
Christopher Blaine McGregor v. Brittany Michelle Gilliland
Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County, Alabama
Case No.: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
Objection To Motion To Continue
Page 1 of 3
DOCUMENT 271
means that discovery should be completed prior to the final hearing date. Therefore,
Petitioner sees no issue in maintaining the trial date that has been currently set;
5. Continuing this case would be prejudicial to Mother and only serves as another tactic
by Respondent to alienate Petitioner and prolong this case, in which she has still yet to
exercise her court-ordered visitation as set out in the .00 case. As it stands, Mother has
not exercised her visitation since February 2024;
WHEREFORE, PREMISES CONSIDERED, Petitioner prays this Honorable Court
DENY Respondent’s Motion to Continue and maintain the October 17, 2025 final trial date.
Respectfully submitted on September 16, 2025.
/s/ Barbara H. Agricola (AGR004)
Attorney for Petitioner
OF COUNSEL:
AGRICOLA LAW
127 South 8th Street
Opelika, Alabama 36801
